result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bond applied 
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on July 1, 2022

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Kennith Daniel Long

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Matthew Kennith Daniel Long. 
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that there is a cash bond to be applied; requests a payment plan for the balance.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Pay $100 + costs = $579.00
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge 
cash bond to be applied

Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on July 1, 2022

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Matthew Kennith Daniel Long. 
Atty Gumz states that the matter is not resolved; requests a Jury Trial.

BACK ON THE RECORD
Atty Gumz has an offer and will be giving the DA a counter offer.  Atty Burdon asks for on more status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:41 PM Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long appeared by phone means.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video means for Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long.
Atty Gumz asks for another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status  Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:25 AM Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant as to why he doesn't have an attorney yet.  Defendant relapsed and is in a sober living house at this time.    Court confirms address and phone.  Atty Juech sent the offer with the complaint.

Court advises that the defendant has the right to an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  set for one more status  Status hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Kennith Daniel Long
Current: 2421 OK Bluff Circle, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2022)
Prior: 1061 13Th Ave, Arkdale, WI 54613
Status hearing on March 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:58 AM Defendant Matthew Kennith Daniel Long appeared by phone means.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court finds probable cause for the charge.

  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get Public Defender appointment.  Court gives the number.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
